author: Staff Reporter
text:
VIT University organised its 21st Annual Alumni Meet – VITAA Day 2016 – on Tuesday. More than 5,000 alumni of the university participated in the meet.

The university’s Chancellor G. Viswanathan distributed educational assistance of Rs. 2.20 lakh to 22 students through funds from the alumni association. He also presented the Chancellor’s special awards and prizes to the institution’s alumni who were working across the globe, according to a press release.

He said the university had a total of 31,000 students from various parts of India and 60 countries. He said that in 2013, VIT University had 1,600 research publications, while it has come up with 2,030 publications now. Through this, it has secured the second place in the country in research publications, second only to the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore that has 2,061 publications, he added, the release said.

Mr. Viswanathan added that the university was taking steps to secure the first place.

He said Rs. six crore was being granted for the education of poor students through funds from the alumni association and VIT University every year. Among others, K.G. Baalakrishnan, chairman of KG Group, Coimbatore participated in the meet.
title: Alumni meet held at VIT University
